activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda M. Cayo

records.addlTxt:
3:14 PM . Defendant Amanda M. Cayo in court. Attorney Megan McGee Norris appearing by video for Amanda M. Cayo. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF179, 22CM181 & 22FO998. Norris representing on 22CM181 only. Court review of case - PD's office still searching for counsel on 22CF179. adj. 03:16 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report

ADDRESS INFO for Amanda M. Cayo
Current: 337 River St Upper A, Eagle River, WI 54521 United States  (Effective: 09-02-2022)
Prior: Homeless, Rhinelander, WI 54501

The defendant is required to be monitored by the Drug Patch through ADL Monitoring Solutions before release. The defendant is ordered to contact ADL at 920-283-1038 to make arrangements. The defendant is responsible for any costs associated with the Drug Patch/No possession or use of prescription medications or controlled substances without valid prescription and ONLY in dosage - manner as prescribed/No possession or use of prescription medications or controlled substances without valid prescription and ONLY in dosage - manner as prescribed.

1:19 PM Defendant Amanda M. Cayo appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF179, 22CM181 & 22FO998. Court review of case. Defendant states has not received written confirmation of bed available at Koinonia - they do not send confirmation - spoke with Human Resource Center - would like signature bond. Court statement to surety bond. Defendant statement to bond. Court states the PD's office filed report - has not been appointed counsel yet. Sowinski statement to bond. Court sets signature bond in 22CF179. Signature bond remains in 22CM181. adj. 01:31 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report

2:02 PM Defendant Amanda M. Cayo appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Also calling 22cm181 and 22fo998.
Court statement to status of PD appointment. and status of surety bond of father.  Defendant statement - Koinonia has bed available as of Sept 1. still looking for other treatment facilities. request sig bond. 
Sowinski statement to bail - Court statement - adj. to 8-31 and if receives written confirmation is received stating bed is available Sept 1 - court may modify bai.  Original surety does remain in effect still.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report
Must live with father/Father must sign as surety/all other conditions remain from cash bond

1:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Amanda M. Cayo appeared by video, in custody. Calling 22CF179, 22CM181 & 22FO998. The defendant is responsible for any costs associated with the Drug Patch/No possession or use of prescription medications or controlled substances without valid prescription and ONLY in dosage - manner as prescribed.
